feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It calculates daily pay by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for public holidays by deducting them from the working days total, and supports both calendar day-based and working day-based leave policies. Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, the system automatically generates a corresponding pay deduction reflected on the payroll table.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages, including salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions with options to select calculation bases and salary components.
Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations by selecting salary components and calculation methods
Calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis to be set off against the employee's monthly pay
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration
Super Admins who have flexibility to configure unpaid deduction calculation options
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator via Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave selection

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist for the employee; the employee's salary information (basic and allowance components) must be configured in the system
Company's public holiday calendar must be set up to exclude weekends and public holidays when using working days calculation base.
User must have super admin role to access and configure leave encashment settings
Access to Leave Settings configuration as a Super Admin
Super admin access to payroll settings; existing payroll system with employee salary data

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary amount (basic salary plus allowance), number of working days in the month, number of calendar days (if using calendar day policy), public holidays falling in the month, approved unpaid leave days

Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and selection of salary components to factor into calculations (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).
Salary components selection (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), calculation method (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and eligible leave types for encashment configuration
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request, calculated daily pay rate, deduction reflected on the payroll table
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and visibility of which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation settings that apply daily deductions to monthly employee payroll
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on selected calculation method; changes apply to all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table

procedures.content: Approve unpaid leave request; determine applicable leave policy (calendar days or working days); identify public holidays in the month; calculate actual working days by subtracting public holidays from total working days; calculate daily pay by dividing salary amount by actual working days; system automatically creates and reflects pay deduction on payroll table

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select a calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose which salary components to include in the calculation.

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure; 2. Select salary components applicable to leave encashments (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances); 3. Choose calculation method (calendar days, working days, or custom days); 4. Configure individual leave types for end-of-service calculations

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and then save the new proration settings.

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay formula: Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) / Number of actual working days in the month. Leave policy determines whether calculation uses calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days). Public holidays must be deducted from working days to arrive at actual working days used in the calculation. The deduction is automatically created upon approval of the unpaid leave request

Calculation can be based on calendar days (actual days in month), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (company-defined, commonly 30 days in UAE and KSA to comply with labor law). Different calculation methods directly impact final wage calculations.

Salary component options are limited to Basic Only or Basic + Allowances; calculation method options are calendar days, working days, or custom days; super admins can see which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten
Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated daily and set off against the employee's monthly pay; Super Admins must choose from predefined calculation methods and day calculation types

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, Super admin must reject the transactions before saving new proration settings.

edge_cases_warnings.content: When public holidays fall within the month, they must be subtracted from the total working days before calculating daily pay. For example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with 22 working days, daily pay is calculated based on 20 days, not 22 days

Calculation varies depending on month length (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February for calendar days). Selection of different calculation bases and salary components can significantly impact final wage amounts.

Super admins should be aware that configuring leave encashment policies will overwrite existing eligible paid leave-type policies, and the system provides visibility into which policies will be affected
Multiple calculation options are available (Basic Only and Basic + Allowances) and multiple day calculation types (Calendar days, Working days, Custom days) must be selected during configuration

When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, Super admin must manually reject and resave transactions to apply new proration settings; failure to do so may result in inconsistent salary calculations.

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: Integrates with leave management system to receive approved unpaid leave requests; connects with payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions; depends on employee records system for salary information and leave policy configuration
The Daily Wage Calculator impacts three main areas: Salary proration, Leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction. It interacts with the company's public holiday calendar and payroll settings.
The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with payroll settings, end-of-service calculations, and leave management systems to customize leave encashment policies
Interacts with the payroll system to apply daily calculated deductions to monthly employee pay; related to Leave Policies and Leave Settings configuration
Interacts with Payroll system, Daily Wage Calculator (DWC) module, and affects active payroll table transactions and employee settlement calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary rate used to deduct unpaid leave days from an employee's salary. Actual working days: The number of working days in a month after deducting public holidays. Calendar days policy: Leave policy based on calendar days (e.g., 30 days per month). Working days policy: Leave policy based on working days (e.g., 22 working days per month). Public holidays: Non-working days recognized by the organization that are deducted from working days

Calendar days: the number of days in a given month (e.g., 31 in January, 28 in February). Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays. Custom days: company-defined calculation base allowing flexibility to align with company policies and labor law (commonly 30 days in UAE and KSA).

Leave encashment: The process of converting unused leave into monetary compensation; End-of-service: Final payroll settlement when an employee leaves the organization; Daily Wage Calculator: Tool for configuring leave encashment policies based on salary components and calculation methods

Unpaid leave: Leave taken without compensation; Daily rate calculation: Method of computing deductions based on daily basis; Basic Only: Calculation method using basic salary only; Basic + Allowances: Calculation method including both basic salary and allowances; Calendar days: Day calculation type based on calendar dates; Working days: Day calculation type based on business working days; Custom days: Day calculation type based on user-defined parameters

Daily Wage Calculator (DWC): System module for configuring salary proration. Salary Proration: Proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation Bases: Methods for determining proration—custom days (user-defined), calendar days (all days in period), or working days (business days only).
